note: Tales from the Penny Bloods, created by Arnold Schmidt & Julia Warren, presents ‘Old Time’ radio plays based on stories from popular nineteenth-century magazines. We dramatize fiction from prestigious Victorian gift annuals and the so-called "Penny Bloods" or "Penny Dreadfuls." You’ll hear thrilling tales in which London's high society meets the city's underworld, plus enjoy adventures & romances, ghosts & criminals, with a dash of comedy thrown in (https://linktr.ee/thepennybloodspodcast).

Project Gutenberg, founded in 1971, is the oldest producer and distributor of free ebooks.

According to Michael Hart (March 8, 1947 – September 6, 2011), founder of Project Gutenberg, the mission of Project Gutenberg is simple: to encourage the creation and distribution of eBooks.
This mission is, as much as possible, to encourage all those who are interested in making eBooks and helping to give them away.
